div.p: The material (text, images, editorial materials, underlying scripts, etc.) on the website is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution Non-Commerical license. This means that you are free to make use of the material in non-commercial ways without asking, however, you must cite the project as the source of the material.
Please cite the website as follows:
The Diary of William Godwin, (eds) Victoria Myers, David O'Shaughnessy, and Mark Philp (Oxford: Oxford Digital Library, 2010). http://godwindiary.bodleian.ox.ac.uk.

Entries in the diary should be cited by date (for example, 21 January 1809); editorial matter should be cited under the appropriate heading For editorial matter on people cite, for example, 'entry for Thomas Holcroft'. For editorial matter on events cite nature of the event and date, for example, ‘entry for theatre/trial/museum/etc. 21 January 1809’.
If you make substantial use of the materials in any form we would appreciate hearing about it at godwin.diary@politics.ox.ac.uk.
If referring to the technological development of the website then James Cummings was the developer.
